description.narrative: Increased Access to Finance for the Low and Middle Income segments: These segments are characterized by low ticket sizes and are not an area of focus for majority of banks and housing finance companies. DHFL is one of the very few HFCs operating on a significant scale in this market through reliance on robust methods of credit assessment.

The proposed project would involve a Senior loan of up to US$70 mn to DHFL, subject to required approvals from RBI. The project will also involve, subject to required approvals from RBI, a co-investment from the Canada Climate Change Program (CCCP) where IFC will act as implementing entity for CCCP to support climate change investments. The project is intended to support the DHFL in growing its assets, increasing its reach and improving its market share. Established in 1984, Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Limited (DHFL) is the second largest private housing finance company in India today. It was the second housing finance company to be set up in the private sector in India, and its stated business objective is to enable access to affordable housing finance to the lower and middle income groups in India. DHFL offers both housing loans (house purchase, construction, extension and project loan) and non housing loans (loan against property, lease rental financing, and purchase of commercial premises).
